Event.description: This game will be played on the Nintendo WiiU.
Event.name: Mario Kart 8

Event.description: This game will be played on the Arcade machine.
Event.name: Donkey Kong (High Score Challenge)

Event.description: Learn to paint miniatures! Paints, brushes, and a free miniature for every participant have been provided by Reaper Miniatures. Painters of all skill levels welcome - just choose a figure, paint it up and take it with you when you're done.
Event.name: Reaper Miniatures Paint & Take

Event.description: All figures and terrain provided. Demo games will be available on demand for systems including Warhammer 40,000; Warmachine and Hordes; Star Wars: X-Wing, Armada, Imperial Assault; Mantic games including Kings of War, Dungeon Saga and Dreadball; Malifaux, Infinity, This Is Not A Test, Batman, Age of Sigmar, SAGA, Guild Ball, Eden and Wild West Exodus.
Event.name: Learn to Play Miniatures Games

Event.description: El Luchador Fantastico Grande is a new Australian standalone card and dice tabletop game that challenges players to become Mexican wrestling super-stars. Players compete to see who can outlast and knock out all opponents or play in one of the three different match modes. Are you ready to become the ultimate Luchador Wrestler?
Event.name: Learn to Play: El Luchador Fantastico Grande

Event.description: We've selected some great new games for you to try, as well as some older games that we think are pretty great. Come to learn and stay to play.
Event.name: Learn to Play: New Games, Old Games, Our Favourite Games

Event.description: In a career spanning over 30 years, Warren is perhaps best known for his work on the critically-acclaimed Deus Ex (2000) and has also produced a range of high profile games including System Shock, Thief: Deadly Shadows, Wing Commander, and Disney Epic Mickey. Pull up a chair and join him for the opening storytime session at PAX Aus! -- Panelists: Warren Spector [Video Game Designer]
Event.name: Storytime with Warren Spector

Event.description: Rocket League is an immediately engaging game with a welcoming community, yet high mastery level. The game has amassed a positive following since its release, making it the perfect lens through which to explore friendly and toxic aspects of online gaming communities. Our panel combines writers, researchers, eSports experts, and enthusiastic Rocket League players to discuss how competitive games can attract a positive, friendly community, and what this can teach us about game design. -- Panelists: Alayna Cole [Videogame writer, researcher, and journalist, University of the Sunshine Coast], Dakoda Barker [Researcher in Serious Games Development, University of the Sunshine Coast], Ben Rolfe [Lecturer, Serious Games, University of the Sunshine Coast], Stacia Grooby [eSports Business and Marketing consultant, eSports/Business Consultant]
Event.name: Rocket League: Community Building in Competitive Games

Event.description: What is the place of video games in education? How can video games enhance learning in science, technology, engineering, and maths (STEM)? Now in its second year, the Australian STEM Video Game Challenge is using video games to engage students in STEM learning in new and exciting ways. Hear from our panel of experts as they explore game development as an engaging, interactive learning activity that is empowering Australian teachers, and inspiring a new generation of switched-on students! -- Panelists: Jaclyn Curnow [ICT Teacher, Mill Park Secondary College, Victoria], Josh Caratelli [Director/Gameplay Programmer, Double Mercury Entertainment], Brie Code [Lead Programmer, Ubisoft Montreal], Chad Habel [Senior Lecturer in the Faculty of Arts, University of Adelaide]
Event.name: Games with Aims: Using Game Development to Power STEM Learning

Event.description: Learn new techniques or hone your skills with our expert painters. All equipment provided.
Event.name: Miniatures Painting Class

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox One.
Event.name: Dead or Alive 5: Last Round

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox One.
Event.name: Killer Instinct

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox One and Sony PlayStation 4.
Event.name: FIFA 15

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox 360.
Event.name: Halo Anniversary

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox One.
Event.name: Kinect Sports Rivals

Event.description: Player Cap; 8 Teams (5)
Event.name: Plants vs Zombies

Event.description: Bring a single ship worth up to 32 points for a fast and furious 3-round competition. Some templates and damage cards will be available to borrow, but bring your own if you have them.
Event.name: X-Wing Miniatures - Dogfighting Tournament

Event.description: Join @nichboy, Producer Pete, and Editor John to join in the production of today's episode of Good Game Pocket. Expect the unexpected and come prepared to laugh, join in and be a part of the show. Once edited what happens will be broadcast to Australia via ABC TV and the world via the internets. -- Panelists: Nich Richardson [Presenter, ABC TV], Peter Burns [Producer, ABC TV], John Emerson [Editor, ABC TV], Janet Carr [Executive Producer, ABC TV]
Event.name: GG Pocket - Making Today's Episode LIVE on Stage

Event.description: Since the 1980s the number of women studying computer science has been falling. Yes – since the 80s. Why? I don't know but I can make up a hundred reasons if you like. Better than predicting the past though –is to take action. So we're designing games that introduce higher level thinking, with bits of maths, science, and tech thrown in. But really just games – where the learning is incidental, and the interaction is only limited by kids' imagination (yeah – limitless). For all genders. -- Panelists: Janine Cahill [Founder and LXD, Teazl], Marianna Cheklin [GameMaker, Kikizoo]
Event.name: Turning Princesses into Astronauts

Event.description: The dexterity hit of PAX last year, see who has the steadiest hand. Sign up for tournaments at TT HQ.
Event.name: Rhino Hero Mini Tournament

Event.description: Which of your mutant monsters, gigantic robots, and strange aliens will become the one and only King of Tokyo. A fun 4-table tournament. Sign up at TT HQ.
Event.name: King of Tokyo Mini Tournament

Event.description: The classic tile-laying game turns 15 this year… but wait! There's more! Will you compete in the classic game or explore one of the variants in this 4-table tournament? Check in at TTHQ to find out and sign up.
Event.name: Carcassonne Mini Tournament

Event.description: Gaming and geeking out is more fun when you do it with others. But as soon as you get people, you get jerkwads who are hellbent on ruining everyone else's fun. How do we stop the few bad apples making our feeds, forums and comment sections hostile and toxic? Our panel of experts will discuss bullying across geekdom - why it happens, how it affects us and how we can minimise it in our communities. -- Panelists: Nicole Stark [Director, Disparity Games], Nicholas Watt [Creative Director, Nnooo], Kamina Vincent [Producer/Editor, Tin Man Games], Tara Brannigan [Snr Community Manager, Wipster (formerly Pik Pok)], Ashley Leach [Managing Director, PoE (formerly Torus)], Lisy Kane [Associate Producer/Community Manager, League of Geeks]
Event.name: Why Can't We All Just Get Along? No, Seriously, Why?

Event.description: Go down in the dungeon. Kill everything you meet. Back-stab your friends and steal their stuff. Grab the treasure and run. Sign up at TT HQ to book your seat for epic fun.
Event.name: Munchkin Events

Event.description: This game will be played on Nintendo DS.
Event.name: Mario Kart

Event.description: Immediately after Storytime with Warren Spector, stick around for a Q&A session featuring Gabe and Tycho of Penny Arcade! Two mics, one heck of a time! Also note that if you can't make it to this panel, there's another one on Sunday in the Main Theatre. These guys are givers. They give. -- Panelists: Gabe and Tycho!
Event.name: Penny Arcade Q&A

Event.description: Player Cap; 64 Players
Event.name: Hearthstone

Event.description: This game will be played on PC.
Event.name: Ikaruga (High Score Challenge)

Event.description: Shape the adventure and make history in this live, interactive, audience-driven RPG event! Join the Dicestormers and legendary game designer Chris Avellone for this next-gen tabletop gaming experience, brought to life by Realm Works, Syrinscape, Dicestormers Game Master Benjamin Loomes, and you! Decide the fate of our players. Share your ideas, determine outcomes, heckle, and more either live or via Twitter @Dicestormers or #LiveRPGPlus! -- Panelists: Derek Proud [Director, Garoo Games], Benjamin Loomes [Creative Director, Syrinscape], Nathan Bennet [Bothan Spy Academy Trainer, The Dicestormers], Murray Dahm [Chief Historian, The Dicestormers], Chris Avellone [Writer, Freelance]
Event.name: RPG+

Event.description: A drop-in game set during the Horus Heresy, as the legions of the Emperor's finest turned upon each other in bloody civil war. Fight for glory or survival, commanding armoured vehicles or squads of troops. All models provided.
Event.name: Warhammer 30,000 - Horus Heresy Big Bash

Event.description: Ever wonder what game developers do all day? Want to be a developer, but not sure which role suits you? Join our amazing panelists to receive a humourous, rapid-fire insight into what game devs get up to behind closed doors. Each panelist gets 20 slides, each of which will be displayed for exactly 20 seconds before automatically advancing, giving them 6 minutes and 40 seconds to describe their daily work life as an indie, artist, programmer, or producer or other. Moderator: Jenn Sandercock -- Panelists: Michael Theiler [Studio Director / Sound Designer, Kpow Pty Ltd], Ben Britten [Technical Director, Mighty Games], Lauren Clinnick [Director, Lumi Consulting], Ariel Magnes [Game Designer, Playdots], Matt Kelly [Community Manager/Game Developer, Infinity Plus Two], Simon Boxer [Lead 2D Artist, Con Artist Games]
Event.name: Microtalks: A Day in the Life of a Game Dev
Magic: The Gathering 64 player Sealed Deck Tournament

Event.description: Paint a miniature figure in an hour - all participants keep their miniature afterwards, and the best painter wins a prize. All equipment provided.
Event.name: Speed Painting Contest

Event.description: The Beta Bar Crew challenge Developers to their own games. -- Panelists: What's on the line? Glory to the winners, humiliation for the losers.
Event.name: Short Games with Drastic Consequences

Event.description: Looking for inspiration for you and the geeklets? Come along and hear geek mums and dads share their favourite family games and activities. Want to know the latest in maker culture for kids? Want family first person shooter suggestions? Some geek advice for your toddler? Or, want to turn your birthday parties in alternate reality games? Our panellists are rich with stories and advice, and keen to engage & learn from you, the audience, as we share the joy of geek parenting or uncling or aunting. -- Panelists: Daniel Donahoo [GeekDad, Project Synthesis], Giselle Rosman [GeekMum, Hipster Whale], Rae Johnston [GeekMum, Allure Media], Craig Peebles [GeekDad, Freelance App Developer], Jane Cocks [GeekMum, University of the Sunshine Coast]
Event.name: Geek Parenting: Cool Things To Do & Play

Event.description: Join Deus Ex Mankind Divided writer Mary DeMarle and Global Brand Manager Rodney Lelu as they showcase the upcoming cyberpunk thriller, taking you through exclusive gameplay and story on the future of Adam Jensen. -- Panelists: Mary DeMarle [Writer, Square Enix], Rodney Lelu [Global Brand Manger, Square Enix]
Event.name: Deus Ex: Mankind Divided - The Augmented Future

Event.description: Player Cap; 64 Players
Event.name: Trackmania Nations Forever (3x Timetrials)

Event.description: This game will be played on Sony PlayStation 1.
Event.name: Point Blank (High Score Challenge)

Event.description: Formed in 2001 with the online smash hit Red Vs Blue, Rooster Teeth has since grown into a Texan-sized production company, responsible for none other than Achievement Hunter, RWBY, The Gauntlet, Immersion, Slo-Mo Guys, and plenty more. Join the Rooster Teeth staff as they go up on stage completely unprepared and wing it! -- Panelists: Joel Heyman, Blaine Gibson
Event.name: Rooster Teeth

Event.description: This game will be played on the Nintendo WiiU.
Event.name: Super Smash Bros

Event.description: Games are played by all kinds of people, but who makes them? Why is that? Is this a problem? What can we do about it? This panel will investigate some practical approaches to supporting, retaining and encouraging women in games development and delve into why game development needs diversity. -- Panelists: Giselle Rosman [Business Administrator, Hipster Whale], Kim Allom [Associate Producer, Defiant Development], Anna Irwin-Schutze [Co-Director, Sound Librarian], Mark Serrels [Editor, Kotaku Australia], Clara Reeves [Manager, Games, Digital Content and Animation, Film Victoria], Morgan Jaffit [Director, Defiant Development]
Event.name: Aiming for Equality: Why Games Should Be For and By Everyone

Event.description: How do you design a video game for an Orang-utan? In this panel, University of Melbourne researchers discuss their research developing digital enrichment for Orang-utans at Melbourne Zoo. Joined by Orang-utan Zoo Keeper Ben Gee and Animal Welfare Scientist Sally Sherwen, come and learn about our research into Orang-utan game play, cognition, and welfare, and hear about how cross-species play can better connect us with these highly intelligent, extraordinarily curious, and individual characters. -- Panelists: Dr. Marcus Carter [Research Fellow, The University of Melbourne], Dr. Sally Sherwen [Animal Welfare Officer, Zoos Victoria], Sarah Webber [PhD Candidate, The University of Melbourne], Ben Gee [Zoo Keeper, Melbourne Zoo]
Event.name: Designing Video Games for Orang-utans

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox One.
Event.name: Halo Master Chief Collection

Event.description: This game will be played on Sony PlayStation 4.
Event.name: NBA 2K15

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox 360.
Event.name: Minecraft (Construction Challenge)

Event.description: Meet and Greet with Mike and Jerry from Penny Arcade!
Event.name: Gabe and Tycho Signing

Event.description: Tabletop Gaming is in something of a renaissance, but how many of those games are accessible for blind or low vision players, without modification? -- Panelists: Answer: About Five.
Event.name: Gaming Blind - Accessibility and Tabletop Games

Event.description: Bring a single ship worth up to 32 points for a fast and furious 3-round competition. Some templates and damage cards will be available to borrow, but bring your own if you have them.
Event.name: X-Wing Miniatures - Dogfighting Tournament

Event.description: This is how it starts. Not with a whimper, but with a BANG! The resounding bang of a ball picking up crap in a room and getting bigger and then picking up bigger crap until the biggest ball of crap wins. It’s honestly an amazing game. Watch was we cull the initial field from 20 to 16 participants.
Event.name: Omegathon Round 1 - Beautiful Katamari

Event.description: Join Coldwood Creative Director, Martin Sahlin, as he shares his personal story about how Unravel came to be. It all started from a camping trip where Martin had to work with the resources he had at his disposal. Using nature and his surroundings, he built this tiny, new character, Yarny, and the game mechanics at the same time to create this unique puzzle platformer. -- Panelists: Martin Sahlin [Creative Director, Coldwood Interactive]
Event.name: The Personal Creation Story of Unravel

Event.description: Learn new techniques or hone your skills with our expert painters. All equipment provided.
Event.name: Miniatures Painting Class

Event.description: This game will be played on the Nintendo 3DS.
Event.name: Animal Crossing

Event.description: Player Cap; 64 Players
Event.name: Unreal Tournament 2004 (Instagib)

Event.description: Over the past decade the video games industry has undergone amazing growth. Set to reach $111 billion this year, it's one of the fastest growing in the world! How does this affect the tabletop market though? Tabletop games (card, board, miniature, RPG) are often seen as going hand in hand with video games but why isn't there more crossover in people playing them? Is it cultural thing? Learning Curve? Maybe just ease of access or lack of joint events like PAX for people to bridge the gap. -- Panelists: Dave Haldane [Game Designer, C117 Games], Amelia Laughlan [Author / Editor, Another Dungeon], Ben Scerri [Associate Game Designer, EA Firemonkeys], Jair McBain [Game / UX Designer, GREE International / Twiitch], Matt Kelly [Game Developer / Community Manager, Infinity Plus Two], Steve Fawkner [Creative Director, Infinity Plus Two]
Event.name: Video Games or Tabletop? Why Not Have Both?

Event.description: As gaming characters increase in complexity - both in terms of emotional and narrative - more and more emphasis is being put on the ability the voice talent to tell the greater story to the player. We'll look at how writers and voice actors work together to build these empathetic and believable characters even when working in fantasy or science fiction worlds. -- Panelists: Nic Healey [Senitor Editor, CNET], Kevin Powe [Voice Over Artist], Dan Hindes [Solo Game Maker, DH], Morgan Jaffit [Director, Defiant], Gemma Laurelle [Voice Over Artist]
Event.name: Vox Ludi: The Increasing Importance of Voice Acting in Games

Event.description: Good Game is show for gamers by gamers that has been broadcast on the ABC since 2006. This year the team expanded to produce a daily show, Pocket and a show especially for the e-sports community called "Well Played". Join the presenters of all the shows in this session where you can ask them (just about) anything. -- Panelists: Steven "Bajo" O'Donnell [Presenter, ABC TV], Stephanie "Hex" Bendixsen [Presenter, ABC TV], Gus "Goose" Ronald [Presenter, ABC TV], Nich "Nichboy" Richardson [Presenter, ABC TV], Michael "Hingers" Hing [Presenter, ABC TV], Janet Carr [Presenter, ABC TV]
Event.name: Good Game - Ask Us Anything (Friday)

Event.description: The game that started it all - 20 years this year. A fun 4-table tournament. Sign up at TT HQ.
Event.name: Settlers of Catan Mini Tournament

Event.description: We may be wrong, but we don't think this was ever not in play at last year's PAX. Join our 4-table tournament of this, the game with the best poker chips ever. Sign up at TT HQ.
Event.name: Splendor Mini Tournament

Event.description: Mini tournament, big game. A fun 4-table tournament. Sign up at TT HQ.
Event.name: Ticket to Ride Mini Tournament

Event.description: We've run Very Big Small World Events for two years, now the Small World is getting a bit smaller. Join our 4 table tournament by signing up at TT HQ.
Event.name: Small World Mini Tournament

Event.description: This year, Assassin's Creed, FIFA, and Call of Duty will let gamers opt to play as women. But does it matter, and does it signal a change to rectify an archaic gender imbalance in video game protagonists? We discuss if this seemingly minor design choice matters to the future of the industry, and how it impacts the people who make games, and those of us who engage with them, both young and old. -- Panelists: Jess McDonell [Host/Producer, GameSpot], Emilie Poissenot [Game Design Lead, Firemonkeys], Mark Wilson [Lead Technical Designer, Ex-BioWare/Team Bondi], Lisy Kane [Community Manager/Associate Producer, League of Geeks], Nicole Stark [Co-Director, Designer, Disparity Games]
Event.name: Who Cares About Female Protagonists?

Event.description: Videogames attract people from many different backgrounds, cultures, genders, and play styles. We all love gaming but in our own, unique way. Many game scholars dedicate their lives to understanding games but from very different intellectual perspectives. Join a social scientist, a psychologist, a philosopher, and an evolutionary biologist for a discussion, game analysis and Q&A about pondering videogames from differing perspectives. -- Panelists: Ms Laura M Crawford [Lecturer in Games and Interactivity, Swinburne University of Technology], Dr Marcus Carter [Research Fellow in the Microsoft Research Centre, University of Melbourne], Dr Steven Conway [Lecturer in Games and Interactivity, Swinburne University of Technology], Dr Michael Kasumovic [Lecturer in the Evolution and Ecology Research Centre, University of New South Wales]
Event.name: Through the Kaleidoscope: Diverse Perspectives on Videogames

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox 360 and Sony PlayStation 4.
Event.name: Guilty Gear Xrd + UMvC3

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox One.
Event.name: Forza 5 (Time Trials)

Event.description: This game will be played on Commodore 64.
Event.name: River Raid (High Score Challenge)

Event.description: Join us for "Twitch Town Hall" where Twitch gives you the opportunity to be heard! This is the first opportunity that Twitch has had to hear from the fans and broadcasters of this region. Come ask questions, learn about what's forthcoming, and get yourself some exclusive Twitch swag! -- Panelists: Marcus "djWHEAT" Graham [Director of Programming, Twitch]
Event.name: Twitch Town Hall: HELLO AUS!

Event.description: Have you ever designed a videogame? How long do you think it takes to design a game from nothing? In this Nanojam, our crack team of game designers will attempt to design a game in the space of a 45 minute panel, with an artist and composer (Maize Wallin!) developing assets live. Sound difficult? Well, on top of that, new ideas will be thrown into the mix by the audience at regular intervals. Come and join us for a fun and enlightening view into the process of game design. Hosted by Jason Imms. -- Panelists: Rami Ismail [Director, Vlambeer], Matt Ditton [Director, Many Monkeys/Mighty Games], Michele Iannello [Lead Designer, Mighty Games], Scott Bartlett [Art Director, Mighty Games], Andrew Sum [Director, Hipster Whale], Jennifer Sheurle [Game Designer and Artist, Flat Earth Games]
Event.name: NanoJam: Let's Design a Game in 45 Minutes

Event.description: Bring a single ship worth up to 32 points for a fast and furious 3-round competition. Some templates and damage cards will be available to borrow, but bring your own if you have them.
Event.name: X-Wing Miniatures - Dogfighting Tournament

Event.description: Paint a miniature figure in an hour - all participants keep their miniature afterwards, and the best painter wins a prize. All equipment provided.
Event.name: Speed Painting Contest

Event.description: "I want to be a game developer!", but do I need to go to school to become one? Or does experience trump all? Students and hobbyists will learn the difference between the various educational pathways into game development. From a degree to good 'ol hard earned experience. Industry panellists will contrast each option; from the eyes of various disciplines ranging from Programming to PR to give you a clearer idea of what your next step is on your journey to working the best job out there. -- Panelists: Josh Caratelli [Director/Gameplay Programmer, Double Mercury Entertainment], Rae Johnston [Journalist, Allure Media], Katie Gall [Director of Marketing and Communications, Lumi Consulting], Izzy Gramp [Developer, Independent], Shell Osborne [Programming Professor, SAE], Dean Woodward [QA, League Of Geeks]
Event.name: Papers Please: Do I Need a Degree?

Event.description: Player Cap; 64 Players
Event.name: Worms Revolution

Event.description: Who said you shouldn't play with your food! Join Stephanie 'Hex' Bendixsen (Good Game), Scott Edgar (Tripod), Mark Serrels (Kotaku Australia) and Eve Beauregard as they prepare their favourite gaming snacks LIVE ON STAGE in our first ever PAX cooking demonstration. Moderated by GeekPlate's Tristan Lutze. -- Panelists: Tristan Lutze [Creator, GeekPlate], Stephanie 'Hex' Bendixsen [Co-Host, Good Game], Scott Edgar [Guitar Guy (Usually), Tripod], Eve Beauregard [Boss, Eve Beauregard], Mark Serrels [Editor, Kotaku]
Event.name: The 1st Annual PAX Food Fight

Event.description: Working in videogames can be a tough gig. When a studio, publisher, or media outlet dies, the consequences are felt by the people who work there and the wider community. But death isn't the end. Find out what comes next. -- Panelists: Paul Houlihan [Publisher, THQ], David Hollingworth [Editor, Atomic], Mark Morrisson [Developer, Melbourne House], Ben Abbott [Developer, Real Time Worlds], Tony Reed [Publisher, Interplay]
Event.name: Life After Death: What Happens When Studios & Publishers Die

Event.description: It’s time to put your favourite amiibo to the test! After training your amiibo as a Figure Player (80’s training montage optional), team up and go head to head with other teams for the chance to win a complete set of Super Smash Bros. Collection amiibo! Be sure to register at the Nintendo Booth before 4:30pm.
Event.name: Super Smash Bros. amiibo Partner Battle Championships

Event.description: How well do you know your way around the wasteland? Do you know your Junktown from Rivet City? Can you list out what each letter in S.P.E.C.I.A.L. stands for? Strap yourself into the Vault for a live trivia on all things Fallout with exclusive prizes up for grabs!
Event.name: Fallout Trivia

Event.description: Player Cap; 12 Teams (5)
Event.name: SMITE

Event.description: A drop-in game set during the Horus Heresy, as the legions of the Emperor's finest turned upon each other in bloody civil war. Join in and fight for glory or survival, commanding armoured vehicles or squads of troops.
Event.name: Warhammer 30,000 - Horus Heresy Big Bash
Dragonball Z Sealed Deck Tournament / Learn to Play Event

Event.description: As DayZ approaches its goal for Beta phase, DayZ Lead Producer Brian -- Panelists: Hicks goes over the goals met this year, what is left to do, where the developers
Event.name: DayZ: The Road to Beta

Event.description: Listen to the stories of players who have gone that extra step for what they love. Some of our panelists are pro players, sent overseas to represent our country. Others have taken it upon themselves to stand up and be counted at international tournaments, or traveled just to be there. -- Panelists: Learn about what it's like to deal with the pressure of competition while fighting jetlag, how you acclimatize to new playstyles, or just the fun of meeting people to play games.
Event.name: Travel the World Playing Video Games - Are You Crazy?

Event.description: Paint a miniature figure in an hour - all participants keep their miniature afterwards, and the best painter wins a prize. All equipment provided.
Event.name: Speed Painting Contest

Event.description: This game will be played on the Nintendo 3DS.
Event.name: Pokemon Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire

Event.description: You ready to get weird? Because shit’s about to get weird. It’s all hands on deck as we make the remaining Omeganauts team up at our whim and battle simultaneously in the wacky world that is Mario Kart: Double Dash! After this blood and tear soaked round, only 12 will remain.
Event.name: Omegathon Round 2 - Mario Kart: Double Dash

Event.description: Have you thought about how chronic conditions, like pain and mental illness, are represented in games? Portrayals are often one-dimensional and inaccurate. In horror games these conditions are seen as villainous, while in action games they are seen as weak and are often erased. This negative portrayal adds to societal stigma. Our panel of health professionals, researchers, game writers, and budding game developers discuss the changes that need to be made in how chronic conditions are represented. -- Panelists: Alayna Cole [Videogame Writer / Researcher / Journalist, University of the Sunshine Coast], Dakoda Barker [Researcher in Serious Games Development, University of the Sunshine Coast], Jane Cocks [Researcher of Psychology - Games and Stories / PhD Candidate, University of the Sunshine Coast], Jennifer Hazel [Psychiatrist / Founder of Prescription Pixel, Prescription Pixel], Katryna Starks [Lecturer in Serious Games, University of the Sunshine Coast]
Event.name: Sick Heroes: Exploring Representations of Illness in Games

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox 360.
Event.name: Ultra Street Fighter 4

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox One and Sony PlayStation 4.
Event.name: COD: Advanced Warfare

Event.description: This game will be played on Microsoft Xbox 360.
Event.name: COD: Black Ops 2

Event.description: Player Cap; 64 Players
Event.name: CS:GO Arms Race

Event.description: A drop-in Epic-scale game of X-Wing. Command a single Starfighter or a squadron. Some figures available to borrow; BYO if you have a particular favourite you'd like to fly.
Event.name: X-Wing Miniatures Big Bash

Event.description: An event for board games designers to show off their creations at different stages - from early prototype to finished product. This is your chance to meet some local designers and talk to them about their games. You might even persuade them to sign your game!
Event.name: Boardgames Australia Presents: Meet the Designer

Event.description: Deck-building fun with… well, we won't tell you which boxes we'll be using. Check in at TT HQ for more info and to sign up for this 4-table tournament.
Event.name: Dominion Mini Tournament

Event.description: Vanillagers, unite! Let's get those pesky wolves out of… whoops. Are my fangs showing?
Event.name: Late Night Werewolf

Event.description: Watch Gabe, Tycho, Angela & Aubrey from the Doubleclicks, and Kris Straub play Quiplash and Fibbage for your entertainment! We've never done this before! It could be super fun, or it could go horribly! But you'll get to see it happen, live on stage!
Event.name: Gabe, Tycho, and Friends

Event.description: Plastic Wax has been in the game cinematic industry for almost 20 years. Creating CG trailers for titles such as Bioshock Infinite, Warhammer: Dawn of War, LEGO Dimensions, Hunger Games 2, Gears of War, and Fallout to name a few. Today we'll walk you through how we create a cinematic trailer from start to finish. From creating highly detailed CG characters, through to award winning VFX, we explore each stage of production and identify what it takes to create a world class cinematic. -- Panelists: Dane Maddams [Executive Vice President, Plastic Wax], Matt Dignam [Studio Manager, Plastic Wax], Nathan Maddams [Creative Director, Plastic Wax], Mick Hammell [Production Manager, Plastic Wax]
Event.name: From Gears of War to LEGO: Deconstructing Game Cinematics

Event.description: Is romance and sex in games becoming more than simple booty calls in return for some sweet power-ups? What's next for our digital dalliances? Join a panel of industry veterans who are experts in games romance from epic RPG titles such as Baldur's Gate: Enhanced Edition to the more niche visual novel genre, and explore in conversation how romance in games is changing around us. -- Panelists: Lucy Morris [Developer, Group Pug], Liam Esler [Event Manager, Game Developers' Association of Australia], Snow McNally [Narrative Designer, Independent], Stephanie Moss [Visual Novel Artist, Stephanie Moss], Lauren Clinnick [Director, Lumi Consulting]
Event.name: Press X To Woo: Mature Relationships & Romance in Games

Event.description: What do you do when you say something on Twitter and it gets retweeted to thousands of people who disagree with you? When the game you've developed hits front page of Reddit for less than amazing reasons? This panel hopes to address some situations where people and brands have suffered at the hands of the "internet mobs" (whether rightly or wrongly), and the effects that it has had. A team of experts will give advice on both how to cope and how to handle the situation if it ever happens to you. -- Panelists: Kelsey Gamble [Social Media Manager, Zomato], Jennifer Hazel [Doctor/Psychiatrist], Mark Serrels [Editor, Kotaku]
Event.name: What Do You Do When the Internet Turns on You

Event.description: Finally, a panel that wrestles with questions that have plagued gaming since its inception - Should games be solo or social experiences? Would you rather be forever alone or always online? Who remembers couch co-op? Our crack team of panelists includes writers and developers who will try to find a definitive answer to this age old debate. By using the best examples of single and multiplayer games they'll attempt to sway their opponents and the final boss, the audience! -- Panelists: Stephen del Prado [Sub-Editor / Podcaster, Player2.net.au], Matthew Hewson [Editor, Player2.net.au], Jason Imms [Journalist, Freelance], Stevie McDonald [Journalist, ind1e.com], Lance McDonald [Developer: Black Annex, Manfightdragon], Sarah Ellen [Journalist, Player2.net.au]
Event.name: Go Solo or Go Social - Single Player vs Multiplayer Gaming

Event.description: Paint a miniature figure in an hour - all participants keep their miniature afterwards, and the best painter wins a prize. All equipment provided.
Event.name: Speed Painting Contest

Event.description: In a globally connected and multicultural world, it's important to see people of different skin colour and cultural backgrounds fairly represented in popular media. It's important to get unique voices and perspectives talking about the things you love. It's important to understand the diverse experiences of your fellow human beings. -- Panelists: And it's important for all of this to exist in the thing we love most: video games.
Event.name: Actually, It's About Ethnics in Games Journalism

Event.description: Fighting Game Gauntlet Challenge - Top players from each game play off in a crossover game challenge!
Event.name: Fighting Game Winner Stays Challenge

Event.description: 2 teams of some of the best Australian streamers, as well as some special guests, are going to pit their gaming ability against The Overlord. They will be tasked with multiple challenges from the evil one itself, and 1 team loses, they will be punished by The Overlord for their failure. If you'd like to see some amazing personalities test their talents, with serious punishment on the line if they fail, then come by and see it live! -- Panelists: JamesTurnerYT [Twitch Streamer & Youtuber], KryticZeuz [Twitch Streamer & Youtuber], JackHuddo [Twitch Streamer & Youtuber], HolmesInFive [Twitch Streamer & Youtuber], Kiraleelee [Twitch Streamer], ClareAgrippina [Twitch Streamer, Author & Deputy Editor for The Australia Times Games Magazine]
Event.name: 6T4Bites Presents: The Overlord Live!

Event.description: What was Mario's original name? What is Resident Evil known as in Japan? Just how many games has Nolan North featured in? If you answered Jumpman, Biohazard, and "all of them," then we have just the panel for you! Join us as we pit our industry experts against each other in a battle of wits and gaming knowledge. Come along and join in the fun; you may even have the chance to stump the panel with your own gaming trivia! -- Panelists: Donald Duong [Presenter, New Game Plus], Jason O'Callaghan [Executive Producer, New Game Plus], Alice Clarke [Freelance Journalist], Paul Houlihan [Host, The Fourth Player], James Dominguez [Freelance Journalist], James Kozanecki [Head of Communications, Surprise Attack]
Event.name: QTE: Quiz Time Event!

Event.description: The Action Points Podcast and the Hyper PixelCast present Play With Us: Wits & Wagers LIVE. Join us for a fun session of the hit trivia party game, Wits & Wagers, where you get to join in on the fun! You don't need to actually know the exact answer to do well in this game, just be the closest or pick the answer that is. -- Panelists: Aaron Lim [Editor-in-Chief, Host, The Action Points Podcast], Evan Ritchie [Host, The Action Points Podcast], Ken Lee [Host, Producer, Hyper PixelCast], Matt West [Host, Hyper PixelCast]
Event.name: Play With Us: Wits & Wagers LIVE

Event.description: If you don't know what this is about, you probably shouldn't be there. Late night adults only fun.
Event.name: Cards Against Humanity FreePlay Event

Event.description: Artwork in tabletop games is a definitive part of their experience, igniting imagination and broadening immersion. Meet a collection of creators tackling all the elements of artistic design - graphics, illustration, and digital - as they discuss the magic behind bringing ideas to life in one of the most important factors of picking or playing a game incl. -- Panelists: Alex Wynnter [Creative Director, Blue Room Games], Alex Drummond [Artist, Alex Drummond Illustration], Max Bane [Developer, Mallegory], Dann May [Creative Director, Game Salute], Allan Chang [Co-Founder, Rule and Make], Liam Alkamraikhi [Artist, TubeFamous]
Event.name: Drawing From The Abyss: Art in the World of Tabletop Gaming

Event.description: Free to Play is quickly becoming one of the major drivers in the present and future of the video game industry. -- Panelists: Much maligned for abusive bait and hook practices, is it evil, or saviour of the game? F2P is now a very broadly defined category, with no one model.
Event.name: Secrets of Free to Play. How F2P is Driving the Future

Event.description: Bonus Stage is a live, talk show just for gamers. Host Carlo Ritchie (The Bear Pack) and Ben O'Brien (Big Head Mode) will be joined on stage by a variety of special guests from the world of comedy, television, and most importantly, video games to ridicule, probe, and play some of the best (and worst) games of the last 30 years. There'll be sketches, Cosplay, gaming, appearances from REAL video game characters, and our resident musical masterminds, Benny Davis and the Triforce! PLUS Special Guests! -- Panelists: Ben O'Brien [Co-Host, Big Head Mode], Carlo Ritchie [Host, Big Head Mode], Rae Johnston [Tech Advisor & Wonder Woman, Kotaku], Seaton Kay-Smith [Comedian & Writer, Paper Moose], Axis of Awesome [Comedians & Musicians, Axis of Awesome]
Event.name: Insert Coin & Big Head Mode present Bonus Stage

Event.description: Skourge Legacy is a new Video Game, TV Show, and Toy Line set in a post apocalyptic world filled with monsters and excitement. We will be revealing everything we can about our brand new world and the adventures that lie within. SKourge Legacy feels like Pokemon meets Fallout with a 90s vibe. We follow the adventures of Jack, Wurm, and Hannah as they journey through a dangerous and exciting world. Join us for a live reveal of this project, win prizes and a Q&A! The world we know is no longer ours. -- Panelists: Wade K. Savage [Creator / Designer, ENCRYPTION]
Event.name: Skourge Legacy: Monsters and Danger in a Post Apoc World

Event.description: Push Me Pull You is a wonderful and ridiculous couch sports game made by Australian developers House House. Join us, and participate in a live PMPY tournament and Q&A, and see for yourself the follies of legs, and the value of friendship. -- Panelists: Matt Neilson [Media Creatures, Producer], Michael McMaster [Developer, House House], Stuart Gillespie-Cook [Developer, House House], Jake Strasser [Developer, House House], Nico Disseldorp [Developer, House House]
Event.name: Push Me Pull You: Live Tournament and Developer Q&A
